title: PHPthrowKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about PHPthrowKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example
Throw an exception:
<?php
try {
throw new Exception("This is an exception");
} 
  catch(Exception $e) {
echo $e->getMessage();
}
?>

Definition and Usage
The
throw
keyword is used to throw exceptions. Exceptions are a way to change the
program flow if an unexpected situation arises, such as invalid data.
The
try...catch...finally
structure can be used to handle exceptions.
Related Pages
The
try
keyword.
The
catch
keyword.
The
finally
keyword.
Read more about try..catch.finally (Exceptions) in our
PHP Exceptions Tutorial
.

★
+1
